intro: Scleranthus annuus var. ruscinonensis, commonly known as the Ruscinonese sicklethorn, is a flowering plant native to parts of Eastern Europe. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant features slender, erect stems with small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are pale yellow and borne in clusters, adding to its ornamental value. It is characterized by its rapid growth and ability to thrive in marginal environments.
